title: Group
text: Definition 1 A group is a non-empty set \(\Group\) together with a binary operation on \(\Group\), denoted “\(\GroupOperation{}{}\)”, that combines any two elements \(\GroupElement\) and \(\GroupElement'\) of \(\Group\) to form an element of \(\Group\), denoted \(\GroupOperation{\GroupElement}{\GroupElement'}\), such that the following three requirements, known as group axioms, are satisfied:

title: Axioms
text:
Definition 1 For all \({a},{b},{c}\) in \(\Set\), one has \(\Operation{(\Operation{a}{b})}{c}=\Operation{a}{(\Operation{b}{c})}\).


Definition 2 There exists an element \(\Identity\) in \(\Set\) such that, for every \({a}\) in \(\Set\), one has \(\Operation{\Identity}{a}={a}\) and \(\Operation{a}{\Identity}={a}\). Such an element is unique and is called the identity element.


Definition 4  

Definition 3 For each \({a}\) in \(\Set\), there exists an element \({b}\) in \(\Set\) such that \(\Operation{a}{b}=\Identity\) and \(\Operation{b}{a}=\Identity\), where \(\Identity\) is the identity element.

For each \({a}\), the element \({b}\) is unique and is called the inverse of \({b}\) and is denoted \(\Inverse{a}\).

title: Axioms
text:
Definition 1 For all \({a},{b},{c}\) in \(\Set\), one has \(\Operation{(\Operation{a}{b})}{c}=\Operation{a}{(\Operation{b}{c})}\).


Definition 2 There exists an element \(\Identity\) in \(\Set\) such that, for every \({a}\) in \(\Set\), one has \(\Operation{\Identity}{a}={a}\) and \(\Operation{a}{\Identity}={a}\). Such an element is unique and is called the identity element.


Definition 4  

Definition 3 For each \({a}\) in \(\Set\), there exists an element \({b}\) in \(\Set\) such that \(\Operation{a}{b}=\Identity\) and \(\Operation{b}{a}=\Identity\), where \(\Identity\) is the identity element.

For each \({a}\), the element \({b}\) is unique and is called the inverse of \({b}\) and is denoted \(\Inverse{a}\).

title: Følner sequence
text:
Definition 4  

Definition 1 We define a right-Følner sequence in \(\Group\) as a sequence \(\Folner =(\Folner[N])_{N\in\mathbb{N}}\) of finite subsets of \(\Gamma\) satisfying \[\lim_{N\rightarrow\infty}\frac{|\GroupOperation{(\GroupOperation{\Folner[N]}{\Inverse{\GroupElement}})}{\Folner[N]}|}{|\Folner[N]|}=1\]for all \(\GroupElement\in\Group\).


Definition 2 Similarly, we define a left-Følner sequence in \(\Group\) as a sequence \(\Folner =(\Folner[N])_{N\in\mathbb{N}}\) of finite subsets of \(\Gamma\) satisfying \[\lim_{N\rightarrow\infty}\frac{|(\Inverse{\GroupElement}\cdot\Folner[N])\cap\Folner[N]|}{|\Folner[N]|}=1 \]for all \(\GroupElement\in\Group\).


Definition 3 We call a sequence a Følner sequence if it is both a left and right Følner sequence.

title: Følner sequence
text:
Definition 4  

Definition 1 We define a right-Følner sequence in \(\Group\) as a sequence \(\Folner =(\Folner[N])_{N\in\mathbb{N}}\) of finite subsets of \(\Gamma\) satisfying \[\lim_{N\rightarrow\infty}\frac{|\GroupOperation{(\GroupOperation{\Folner[N]}{\Inverse{\GroupElement}})}{\Folner[N]}|}{|\Folner[N]|}=1\]for all \(\GroupElement\in\Group\).


Definition 2 Similarly, we define a left-Følner sequence in \(\Group\) as a sequence \(\Folner =(\Folner[N])_{N\in\mathbb{N}}\) of finite subsets of \(\Gamma\) satisfying \[\lim_{N\rightarrow\infty}\frac{|(\Inverse{\GroupElement}\cdot\Folner[N])\cap\Folner[N]|}{|\Folner[N]|}=1 \]for all \(\GroupElement\in\Group\).


Definition 3 We call a sequence a Følner sequence if it is both a left and right Følner sequence.
